documentation.text: @notice Send eth through portal by first wrapping it to WETH

@notice Send eth through portal by first wrapping it.
 @dev This type of transfer is called a "contract-controlled transfer".
 There are three differences from a regular token transfer:
   1) Additional arbitrary payload can be attached to the message
   2) Only the recipient (typically a contract) can redeem the transaction
   3) The sender's address (msg.sender) is also included in the transaction payload
 With these three additional components, xDapps can implement cross-chain
 composable interactions.

@notice Send ERC20 token through portal.
 @dev This type of transfer is called a "contract-controlled transfer".
 There are three differences from a regular token transfer:
 1) Additional arbitrary payload can be attached to the message
 2) Only the recipient (typically a contract) can redeem the transaction
 3) The sender's address (msg.sender) is also included in the transaction payload
 With these three additional components, xDapps can implement cross-chain
 composable interactions.

completeTransfer(bytes).details: The msg.sender gets paid the associated fee.
completeTransfer(bytes).notice: Complete a transfer of an ERC20 token.

params.encodedVm: A byte array containing a VAA signed by the guardians.

completeTransferAndUnwrapETH(bytes).details: The msg.sender gets paid the associated fee.
completeTransferAndUnwrapETH(bytes).notice: Complete a transfer of WETH and unwrap to eth.

params.encodedVm: A byte array containing a VAA signed by the guardians.

completeTransferAndUnwrapETHWithPayload(.details: The transaction can only be redeemed by the recipient, typically a contract.
completeTransferAndUnwrapETHWithPayload(.notice: Complete a contract-controlled transfer of WETH, and unwrap to ETH.

params.encodedVm: A byte array containing a VAA signed by the guardians.

returns._0: The byte array representing a BridgeStructs.TransferWithPayload.

completeTransferWithPayload(bytes).details: The transaction can only be redeemed by the recipient, typically a contract.
completeTransferWithPayload(bytes).notice: Complete a contract-controlled transfer of an ERC20 token.

params.encodedVm: A byte array containing a VAA signed by the guardians.

returns._0: The byte array representing a BridgeStructs.TransferWithPayload.

transferTokensWithPayload(address,uint25.details: This type of transfer is called a "contract-controlled transfer". There are three differences from a regular token transfer: 1) Additional arbitrary payload can be attached to the message 2) Only the recipient (typically a contract) can redeem the transaction 3) The sender's address (msg.sender) is also included in the transaction payload With these three additional components, xDapps can implement cross-chain composable interactions.

wrapAndTransferETH(uint16,bytes32,uint25.notice: Send eth through portal by first wrapping it to WETH

wrapAndTransferETHWithPayload(uint16,byt.details: This type of transfer is called a "contract-controlled transfer". There are three differences from a regular token transfer:   1) Additional arbitrary payload can be attached to the message   2) Only the recipient (typically a contract) can redeem the transaction   3) The sender's address (msg.sender) is also included in the transaction payload With these three additional components, xDapps can implement cross-chain composable interactions.
wrapAndTransferETHWithPayload(uint16,byt.notice: Send eth through portal by first wrapping it.
